questions.question: I ate as much as I …………………………
questions.description: We use could to show past ability.

questions.question: She ………………………… walk when she was just eight months old.
questions.description: We use could to show past ability.

questions.question: Shyam ……………………………… write with both hands. (present ability)
questions.description: Can is used to talk about present ability.

questions.question: She is confident that she ………………………….. get the job.
questions.description: Will shows simple futurity. It is used to predict future.

questions.question: He was sacked because he ……………………………. not meet the targets.
questions.description: Either could or would can be used here with different meanings. Could not shows inability. Would not shows reluctance.

questions.question: She said that she ………………………….. come but she didn’t.
questions.description: Would is the past tense of will in indirect speech.

questions.question: If I had more money, I ……………………………….. build a home.
questions.description: Either could be used here with slightly different meanings.

questions.question: If I were you, I …………………………… pay 2000 bucks for that used car.
questions.description: Would not shows refusal. Could not shows inability.

questions.question: You ………………………….. visit me whenever you want.
questions.description: Can is used to make a request, to ask for permission or to express ability to do something.

questions.question: Who ……………………………. pay for the drinks?
questions.description: Will is used to predict something, to express willingness or to announce a spontaneous decision. Can shows ability.

questions.question: ………………………… you mind closing the door?
questions.description: Would is used in polite requests.

questions.question: I wanted to scream but I …………………………….
